item.title: Microseismicity in South Island, New Zealand
item.description: Seismicity rate changes when the stress state in the crust changes. Both seismicity and geodetic data are readily available to us.

item.title: Earthquake Model of the Middle East
item.description: Objective Looking into ways of incorporate fault information into hazard calculations. Do different tools gives completely different result? Now it sounds awfully similar to what Fault2SHA want to do.

item.title: Seismic Tomography
item.description: Finite-frequency tomography For my master thesis with Prof Shu-Huei Hung, I work with finite-frequency tomography to image the mantle below Basin and Range province, USA.

item.title: Simulate earthquake sequences in 3-D fault systems
item.description: How to create a [[notes/modeling earthquakes|synthetic seismic sequence]]? Surely one can use the statistics to generate one. But we know plates move and faults slide.

item.title: Strain rate to Seismicity Rate
item.description: Does the rate of surface deformation proportional to the rate of earthquakes? Can change in strain rate translate to change in seismicity rate?
